content: For those attending ICFP this week, my Q&A session about "Sealing Pointer-Based Optimizations Behind Pure Functions" is about to start. The presentation is nearing the end but they get recorded. I don't know if they will be publicly available though
Oh, I had no idea there was a conference this week!
I would have watched your presentation.
Apologies, I always seem to advertise too late. It's International Conference on Functional Programming. It might have flown under your radar
The title suggests it flew way below my rader indeed. But I would still have watched yours!
Is there anyone else from here giving a talk?
You're not too late, you can still watch it in beijing time
What?
oh right, now I remember why I didn't sign up, registration is not free
What?

Wonderful! Are you registered @Mario Carneiro?

Thanks @Patrick Massot, I hope you watch it and enjoy it. I don't recognize any other Leaner.
they are doing a thing where they air it twice, in new york time and beijing time
Is Simon flying to Beijing now?
Only my bytes
we're all citizens of the world
It's pre-recorded and it airs right before we connect on Zoom for a Q&A.
What's the point of doing this instead of putting it on YouTube for people living in Beijing and elsewhere?
conferences are weird
Oh, it explains how you could come to Zulip to warn about the Q&A while finishing your talk.
That also seemed a tad weird.
The Q&A session I believe. And I think scheduling it makes it more likely that people will interact on the subject
Multitasking :)
Also, Daniel gave the talk
you should see if they are going to release the talks
They're on YouTube. My paper is https://youtu.be/i9wgeX7e-nc at 1h06
In math we call this a video, not a paper.
Such weird cultural differences
Looks to be at 58:15

Patrick Massot said:

What's the point of doing this instead of putting it on YouTube for people living in Beijing and elsewhere?

I think youtube is blocked in China (at least according to my university we should not put any videos on YouTube and require students watch them for this reason while remote learning).
It could be on any website, but I got the actual answer somewhere in this thread, the goal is to have a live Q&A session.
